ProcedureHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PROC COPY OUT=libref-1 IN=libref-2 <CLONE|NOCLONE> 
    <CONSTRAINT=YES|NO> <DATECOPY> <INDEX=YES|NO> 
    <MEMTYPE=(mtype-1 <...mtype-n>)> <MOVE <ALTER=alter-password>>;
        EXCLUDE SAS-file-1 <...SAS-file-n> </ MEMTYPE=mtype>;  
        SELECT SAS-file-1 <...SAS-file-n> </ <MEMTYPE=mtype> <ALTER=alter-password>>; 

The COPY procedure copies one or more SAS files from a SAS library. 

Generally, the COPY procedure functions the same as the COPY statement in the DATASETS 
procedure. The two differences are as follows: 

The IN= argument is required with PROC COPY. In the COPY statement, IN= is optional. 
If IN= is omitted, the default value is the libref of the procedure input library.

PROC DATASETS cannot work with libraries that allow only sequential data access.

Note: The MIGRATE procedure is available specifically for migrating a SAS library 
from a previous release to the most recent release. For migration, PROC MIGRATE offers 
benefits that PROC COPY does not.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: OUT=libref-1] 
      
Names the SAS library to copy SAS files to.

[Syntax: IN=libref-2] 
      
Names the SAS library containing SAS files to copy.

[Syntax: ALTER=alter-password] 
      
Provides the alter password for any alter-protected SAS files that you are moving 
from one data library to another.

Specifies to copy the following data set attributes:
      
      o size of input/output buffers

      o whether the data set is compressed

      o whether free space is reused

      o data representation of input data set, library, or operating environment

      o encoding value

      o whether a compressed data set can be randomly accessed by an observation number

Specifies not to copy the following data set attributes:
      
      o size of input/output buffers

      o whether the data set is compressed

      o whether free space is reused

      o data representation of input data set, library, or operating environment

      o encoding value

      o whether a compressed data set can be randomly accessed by an observation number
Specifies whether to copy all integrity constraints when copying a data set.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies to copy all integrity constraints when copying a data set.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies not to copy all integrity constraints when copying a data set.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
Copies the SAS internal date and time when the SAS file was created and the date and time 
when it was last modified to the resulting copy of the file. Note that the operating 
environment date and time are not preserved.

[Syntax: ENCRYPTKEY=key-value] 
      
Specifies the key value needed to copy data sets in the IN= library that have AES encryption. 

Note: If the output library does not support AES encryption and the input data set is AES 
encrypted, the COPY process will error.
Specifies whether to copy all indexes for a data set when copying the data set to another SAS library.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies to copy all indexes for a data set when copying the data set to another SAS library.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies not to copy all indexes for a data set when copying the data set to another SAS library.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata: Allows you to use the MOVE option for a SAS data set on which an audit trail exists.

[Syntax: MEMTYPE=(mtype-1 <...mtype-n>)] 
      
Restricts processing to one or more types of SAS files.

Moves SAS files from the input data library (named with the IN= option) to the output 
data library (named with the OUT= option) and deletes the original files from the 
input data library.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
EXCLUDE SAS-file-1 <...SAS-file-n> </ MEMTYPE=mtype>; 
      
Excludes specified files or entries from the copy process.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Restricts processing to one member type. You can use the option either in parentheses 
after the name of each SAS file or after a forward slash.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: SELECT SAS-file-1 <...SAS-file-n> </ <MEMTYPE=mtype> <ALTER=alter-password>>;
      
Selects SAS files for copying.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ALTER=alter-password] 
          
Provides the alter password for any alter-protected SAS files that you are moving 
from one data library to another.

[Syntax: ENCRYPTKEY=key-value] 
      
Specifies the key value for AES encryption.

Restricts processing to one member type. You can use the option either in parentheses 
after the name of each SAS file or after a forward slash.
